Detailed Description

The simplest learning strategy.

The steepest descent strategy uses the calculated error derivatives to adjust the weights of the network.

Author:

void SteepestDescent::clearMemory (  )  [inline]

Clears the array of momentum values.

The momentum values are the values that are added to the weights for updating.

double  lr = 0.1,
double  mu = 0.3 
) [inline]

Iterative updating of the weights by presenting all patterns.

Similar to learnBatch, but here all patterns are presented to the network sequentially and the weights are updated after each pattern.

void SteepestDescent::learnOnline ( const Array< double > &  in,
const Array< double > &  target,
double  lr = 0.1,
double  mu = 0.3 
) [inline]

Iterative updating of the weights by presenting one pattern.

After presenting one pattern to the network the weights are iteratively updated by moving a short distance in the direction of the greatest decrease of the error, i.e. in the direction of the negative gradient by using the error derivatives dedw. Additionally a momentum term is added to the gradient descent to deal with the problem of widely differing eigenvalues. The update of a weight at time to a weight at time is then given as

Parameters:
in Input vector for the model.
target Target vector.
lr Learning rate .
mu Momentum parameter .
Returns:
None.
Author:
C. Igel
Date:
